title: PCI DSS
short: Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS) is a set of security protocols designed to ensure that companies handling credit card information maintain a secure environment. It provides guidelines for protecting sensitive data and preventing fraud.
long: The Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS) is a comprehensive set of security controls designed to protect cardholder data. It applies to any organization that handles, processes, or stores credit card information. The standard consists of 12 requirements, which include installing and maintaining a firewall, encrypting cardholder data, and implementing strong access control measures. Compliance with PCI DSS is mandatory for organizations handling credit card data, and involves regular security audits and risk assessments. By following PCI DSS guidelines, companies can significantly reduce the risk of credit card fraud and protect sensitive customer data.
